column2: A Chrome extension that lets you modify running apps without reloading them.

Given that it has been properly refactored

Handle and emit errors from Watcher

This prevents the Flo session from crashing, making it more resilient,
and gives consumers of Flo the opportunity to handle watcher's errors.

On windows, the file path contains back slashes

Ensure that resourceURL is transformed to replace back slashes with
forward slashes

Proper backwards compatibility

So I had missed that the background page is a page of its own of course
and thus with a localStorage of its own. Now that’s taken in
consideration and fixed.

Spaces instead of tabs, backwards compatibility

Made use of the localStorage key „flo-config“ which should guarantee
backwards compatibility.

Enabled workaround for localStorage

Access to localStorage does not work once „Block third-party cookies
and site date“ is enabled. This is a workaround based on
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=178618#c25

Implement matching feature on the client.
Update client code to match protocol.
Remove function serialization feature.

Implement match feature:
* Every resolver callback instance can return a matching function to flo that would be sent to the client to be performed as a matching predicate to get the resource that would be updated.
* the matching function could be a string indicating a built-in function:
	* "equal" which performs an equal check between on the resourceURL and resource in the browser.
	* "indexOf" preforms an index of and checks `> -1`.
* it also could be a function or a regexp object that would be serialized and sent to the client to be recompiled and used as the match funciton.
